name: chronobiology
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the changes in the body's physiology (= the way that it works and the physical processes that happen inside it) at different times of the day and night, or the study of this: Sleep disturbances may involve disrupted chronobiology, characterized by excessive daytime napping. As a pioneer in the field of chronobiology, he was able to accurately explain the cause of jet lag and how human bodies can adjust.
More examplesFewer examplesHe is the author of Rhythms of Life, a book on chronobiology.Dr Hastings is a physiologist who specializes in chronobiology, the study of the body's natural rhythms, at Cambridge University.The professor, an expert in chronobiology and exercise, says that most research suggests late afternoon and early evening as the best times to work out.Late morning is when your brain's ability to process information is at its best, says a professor at the University of Pittsburgh's sleep and chronobiology centre.
